intro: Crotalaria pearsonii, commonly known as Pearson's crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with three to five leaflets, and its seed pods are typically cylindrical and dehiscent. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
